page.title: 13Leisure:Chinnor etc
page.content: The strong community spirit in Chinnor has promoted many leisure opportunities. Chinnor Players, a drama group, performs in the Village Hall and the Chinnor Operatic Society also puts on regular productions there. Chinnor Silver Band has a healthy record in competitions around the district, with a section for younger musicians. Cubs, Scouts, Guides and Brownies also cater for the many young children of the village. Soccer is played on two playing fields, one of which is also used for cricket matches in the summer. Regular whist drives are held and the six public houses in Chinnor generate activities like darts, bar billiards and Aunt Sally. In Sydenham, inns compete at cricket, Aunt Sally, general knowledge contests etc. There is a field donated for recreation.
